sen.j: 西園寺公満（さいおんじ きんみつ、元和 (日本)8年（1622年）‐慶安4年7月20日 (旧暦)（1651年9月4日））は、江戸時代前期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinmitsu SAIONJI (1622 - September 4, 1651) was Kugyo in the early Edo period.
Kinmitsu SAIONJI (1622 - September 4, 1651) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: a Court Nobleを追加しました。
sen.e: Kinmitsu SAIONJI (1622 - September 4, 1651) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 後水尾天皇（108代）、明正天皇（109代）、後光明天皇（110代）の三帝に仕え、官位は従三位中納言まで昇る。
sen.e: He served three Emperors, Emperor Gomizunoo (108th), Emperor Meisho (109th) and Emperor Gokomyo (110th), and was promoted to Jusanmi Chunagon (Junior Third Rank, Associate Chief of the Councillor of State).

He served for the three sovereigns who were the 108th Emperor Gomizunoo, the 109th Emperor Meisho and the 110th Emperor Gokomyo; He was promoted up to Jusanmi Chunagon (Junior Third Rank and Associate Chief of the Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: Forを追加しました。Emperors→sovereignsに訂正し、who wereを追加しました。訳抜けのため、promoted up to としました。Rankのあとにandを追加ししました。
sen.e: He served for the three sovereigns who were the 108th Emperor Gomizunoo, the 109th Emperor Meisho and the 110th Emperor Gokomyo; He was promoted up to Jusanmi Chunagon (Junior Third Rank and Associate Chief of the Councilor of State).

sen.j: 父は左大臣西園寺実晴。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (minister of the left) Saneharu SAIONJI.
His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Saneharu SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: 役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。
sen.e: His father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Saneharu SAIONJI.

sen.j: 母は細川忠隆の娘徳姫。
sen.e: His mother was Tokuhime, a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.
His mother was Tokuhime who was a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.
His mother was Tokuhime who was a daughter of Tadataka HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 室は棚倉藩主松平康重の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of the lord of Tanagura domain, Yasushige MATSUDAIRA.
His wife was a daughter of the lord of the Tanagura domain, Yasushige MATSUDAIRA.
sen.cmt: Tanaguraの前にtheを追加しました。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of the lord of the Tanagura domain, Yasushige MATSUDAIRA.

sen.j: 子に近衛府西園寺実尚、中納言久我通名室がいる。
sen.e: He had children, Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) Sanenao SAIONJI and a wife of Chunagon Michina KOGA.
He had several children, including Sanenao SAIONJI who was Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and a daughter who became a wife of Chunagon Michina KOGA.
sen.cmt: several, including, who was, a daughter who becameを追加しました。
sen.e: He had several children, including Sanenao SAIONJI who was Konoefu (the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and a daughter who became a wife of Chunagon Michina KOGA.
In 1624, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1624, he was conferred a peerage.
In 1624, he was conferred a peerage.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として速いスピードで累進して、寛永16年（1639年）には従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: After that, he was quickly promoted from one position to another as the family head of the Seiga family, and in 1639, he took the post of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and was ranked with Kugyo.
Since then, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1639, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: After that→Since thenを訂正しました。 he was quickly promoted from one position to another as the family headの部分を訂正しました。he took the post of→became, was ranked with→which gave him the titleに訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, being the head of the Seiga family, he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1639, he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: 寛永18年（1641年）権中納言、正保4年（1644年）には踏歌節会外弁となる。
sen.e: In 1641, he took the post of Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state), and in 1644, he took the post of Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony)).

He took some positions such as "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) in 1641 and "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) in 1644.
sen.cmt: 各役職に""を追加し、役職の単語の頭文字を大文字にしました。()内のカッコを[]に訂正しました。Post→positionに訂正しました。
sen.e: He took some positions such as "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) in 1641 and "Toka no sechie Geben" (Kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]) in 1644.

sen.j: 慶安2年（1649年）に任職を辞し、慶安4年（1651年）には三十歳の若さで薨去した。
sen.e: He resigned his posts in 1649, and he died at an early age of 30 in 1651.
He resigned the positions in 1649; He died young at the age of 30 in 1651.
